doc.ContractDescription: 6X6 DUMP, 14-18 CU YDS, 64000-68000 LBS GVWR 6X6 DUMP, 14-18 CU YDS, 64000-68000 LBS GVWR

IN THE COMING DECADE, X-RAY ASTRONOMY WILL REQUIRE NEW SOFT X-RAY DETECTORS THAT CAN BE READ VERY QUICKLY WITH LOW NOISE AND CAN ACHIEVE SMALL PIXEL SIZES OVER A MODERATELY LARGE FOCAL PLANE AREA. THESE REQUIREMENTS WILL BE PRESENT FOR A VARIETY OF X-RAY MISSIONS THAT WILL ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS SCIENCE THAT WAS HIGHLY RANKED BY THE DECADAL REVIEW, INCLUDING MISSIONS WITH SCIENCE THAT OVERLAPS WITH IXO SCIENCE, AS WELL AS OTHER MISSIONS ADDRESSING SCIENCE TOPICS BEYOND THOSE OF IXO. SMART-X, WHICH WAS DESCRIBED IN A RECENT NASA RFI RESPONSE, PROVIDES AN EXAMPLE OF A FUTURE MISSION CONCEPT WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS SINCE IT HAS HIGH X-RAY THROUGHPUT AND EXCELLENT SPATIAL RESOLUTION. WE PROPOSE TO MODIFY CURRENT ACTIVE PIXEL SENSOR DESIGNS, IN PARTICULAR THE HYBRID CMOS DETECTORS THAT WE HAVE BEEN WORKING WITH FOR SEVERAL YEARS, AND IMPLEMENT NEW IN-PIXEL TECHNOLOGIES THAT WILL ALLOW US TO ACHIEVE THESE AMBITIOUS AND REALISTIC REQUIREMENTS ON A TIMELINE THAT WILL MAKE THEM AVAILABLE TO UPCOMING X-RAY MISSIONS.
doc.MajorAgency: NOVEL HYBRID CMOS X-RAY DETECTOR DEVELOPMENTS FOR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NOVEL HYBRID CMOS X-RAY DETECTOR DEVELOPMENTS FOR
